name: mSCAPE
description: Metagenomics Surveillance, Collaboration and Analysis Programme.

adm1_country.description: The country where the sample was collected.

adm2_region.description: [NOT YET SUPPORTED] Upper Tier Local Authority name as per https://geoportal.statistics.gov.uk/datasets/ons::upper-tier-local-authorities-dec-2022-names-and-codes-in-the-united-kingdom

batch_id.description: Used to identify samples prepared in the same laboratory batch (e.g. extraction, library and/or sequencing).

bioinformatics_protocol.description: Detail of initial bioinformatics protocol, for example versions of basecalling software and models used, any read quality filtering/trimming employed.

biosample_source_id.description: Unique identifier for an individual to permit multiple samples from the same individual to be linked.

collection_date.description: The date the sample was collected.

dehumanisation_protocol.description: Details of bioinformatics method used for human read removal.

extraction_enrichment_protocol.description: Details of nucleic acid extraction and optional enrichment steps.

input_type_details.description: Named control or standard, or respiratory_infection if sample.

is_approximate_date.description: The date is approximate e.g. the sample is from a public repository and it is unclear whether the date corresponds to collection or publishing.

is_public_dataset.description: The sample is from a public dataset.

public_database_accession.description: The accession for the data in the public database.

public_database_name.description: The public repository where the data is.

received_date.description: The date the sample was received by the sequencing centre (if collection_date unavailable).

run_id.description: The unique identifier assigned to the run by the sequencing instrument.

sample_id.description: The sequencing provider's identifier for the sequenced sample.

sample_latitude.description: North-south geographic coordinate of the sample (public data only).

sample_longitude.description: East-west geographic coordinate of the sample (public data only).

sample_source.description: The source from which the sample was collected.

sample_type.description: The type of sampling method used.

sequence_purpose.description: Used to differentiate between clinical or research studies.

spike_in.description: The type of spike-in used in the run.

study_id.description: Used to identify study or if NHS residual sample.
